newsitem.title: USA: Kollmorgen CEO sees 15 pct growth - BARRONS.
newsitem.headline: Kollmorgen CEO sees 15 pct growth - BARRONS.

text.p: Kollmorgen Corp chief executive officer Gideon Argov expects the company to sustain earnings growth of at least 15 percent a year on average for the next five years on revenue gains averaging at least 10 percent, according to Barron's.
The newspapaer said that Argov anticiaptes that the company will earn $1 a share or more in 1997.
Kollmergen earned $0.86 a share on revenues of $230 million in 1996.
In the article, the Kollmorgen chief projects that foreign sales will comprise more than half of total revenue, with business outside the U.S. representing about 40 percent this year.
